ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Otosclerosis (post-stapedectomy)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of stapedectomy on the right ear with persistent mixed hearing loss and opaque eardrum.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Left ear shows mild-to-moderate high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Primary complaint of bothersome ringing, matched to 4000 Hz, with moderate handicap (THI 56).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Reduced loudness tolerance (LDLs 80-90 dB HL) and reported sensitivity to loud sounds.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess ear canal and tympanic membrane status, especially given surgical history.
To determine degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function and compliance.
To assess retrocochlear pathway, though limited by hyperacusis.
To measure loudness discomfort levels (LDLs) due to reported sound sensitivity.
To characterize tinnitus pitch, loudness, maskability, and residual inhibition.
To quantify tinnitus handicap (THI) and functional impact (TFI).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with asymmetric hearing loss: mild-to-moderate high-frequency SNHL in the left ear and mild-to-severe mixed loss in the right ear, consistent with his history of stapedectomy. Word recognition is excellent bilaterally. Key findings include reduced loudness tolerance (LDLs 80-90 dB HL) indicating hyperacusis, and bothersome tinnitus matched to 4000 Hz. Tinnitus assessment shows positive residual inhibition and a Minimum Masking Level of 26 dB SL.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Left ear clear/normal; Right ear opaque eardrum consistent with surgical history.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left: Normal through 2000 Hz, sloping to mild-to-moderate SNHL at 3000 Hz+. Right: Asymmetric mild-to-severe mixed hearing loss with low-frequency gap.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs consistent with PTA. WRS 100% at 40 dB SL bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Left: Normal (Type A). Right: Reduced compliance (Type As), consistent with stapedectomy.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Pure tone ARTs not assessed due to discomfort. Broadband noise ARTs present left, absent right.

tests.name: Loudness Contour Test
tests.result_summary: Reduced tolerance for pure tones; LDLs 80-90 dB HL.

tests.name: Tinnitus Assessment
tests.result_summary: Pitch match 4000 Hz; Loudness match 13 dB SL; MML 26 dB SL (44 dB HL); Residual Inhibition 32 seconds.

tests.name: Self-Report Scales
tests.result_summary: THI 56 (moderate handicap); TFI 51; COAT minimal concern with hearing loss.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: 1-month follow-up: Patient reported hearing better in small groups and better tolerating collective sound levels. He was pleased with the reduction in duration and loudness of his tinnitus.

tests.name: Self-Report Scales
tests.result_summary: THI 42; TFI 36; COSI: Pleased with reduction in duration and loudness.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: 3-month follow-up: Tinnitus reported at a manageable level; successfully practicing PMR to assist with sleep.

proposed_items: Bilateral amplification (RIC devices) combined with sound therapy (TRT).
App-based masker for overnight use to avoid waking into complete quiet.
counseling_actions: Explain the connection between residual hearing loss and tinnitus.
Validate sound sensitivity (hyperacusis) based on Loudness Contour results.
Instruct on biofeedback exercises (PMR/DB) to manage reaction to tinnitus.
Discuss sound therapy strategy (mixing point below 50 dB SPL).

escalation.rationale_short: Proceed with in-house management of tinnitus and hearing loss; patient has already received ENT clearance.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor progress with amplification, sound therapy, and sleep improvement.

expected_outcome: COSI questionnaire: Patient pleased with reduction in duration and loudness of tinnitus.
Subjective report: Hearing better in small groups and better tolerating collective sound levels.
Subjective report: Tinnitus at a manageable level; successfully practicing PMR to assist with sleep.
